task_summary: The robot visually detects and approaches a towel lying on a workspace, aligning above it to reach the target as specified.

task_long_description.overview: This task involves a stationary manipulator reaching a towel positioned on a workspace. The robot sequentially perceives (localizes) the towel, moves above it at an appropriate height to avoid collision, and finally approaches to align its end-effector above the towel. No grasping or manipulation is requested—the goal is simply to reach above the towel. The workspace is uncluttered, and only the towel and table are relevant objects.
preconditions: Towel is present and visible on the workspace
No obstacles between the robot and towel
stepwise_plan: Move end-effector above the towel with vertical offset
Approach and align precisely above towel
success_criteria: End-effector is positioned directly above the towel
No collision with table or towel
task_long_description.termination: Task ends when the robot's end-effector reaches the aligned position above the towel or upon repeated failure.

frame_3.now_evidence: first stable contact and alignment cue visible
frame_3.predicts_next: push actuation expected; confirms goal direction

node_specs.description: Detect and localize the towel on the workspace.
Move the end-effector to a position above the towel with 0.10m vertical offset.
Approach and precisely align end-effector above the towel.

failure_modes: Towel not detected due to occlusion or perception error
Collision with table due to mislocalization
recovery_strategy: Retry perception if towel not found
assumptions: No grasp or pick action is required; visual evidence shows only reaching and alignment.
Frames show an approach and alignment task, not manipulation.
Timeouts and forces are not specified as the instruction and context don't indicate urgency or forceful interaction.

expected_success_criteria: Robot is directly above the towel at the end of execution
No contact or grasp is performed, only approach and alignment
